channel.title: Mozilla Firefox vs Internet Explorer
channel.description:
For the people who don't know what Firefox or Internet Explorer is... They are web browsers you use to surf the web. A lot of people are on IE, Firefox, AOL, Netscape, Opera, or some other wacky browser. The best, free browser to cross my eyes has been Firefox.
Let's look at the positives and negatives of both Firefox and IE browsers.
For the people who already have firefox and are just reading this for kicks, check out this tutorial on [url=http://goons.freepgs.com/tutorials.php?p=How_to_Speed_Up_Firefox]How to speed up Firefox[/url].
[b]-> Firefox[/b] [img]http://projects.edtech.sandi.net/lewis/thumbs/images/t_up.gif[/img] + Very easy to customize and style + Internet Options very simple to manage + A nice Bookmarks toolbar + Able to install many many extensions which are on the mozilla.org website and are checked + VERY VERY VERY SECURE! + Big fixes and a nice forum to help you with any trouble you "think" you face with firefox + Uses fewer resources than IE + Built in Search Engines for easy searching with Google, Yahoo!, and many more, and you can even add more search engines + Superb popup block feature + Able to block images from websites so you can get rid of those annoying fastclick.net and many other ads + Can open new windows in tabs, so you don't have to have 500 windows open anymore + Faster Browsing which is possible because of improvements to the engine that powers Firefox deliver more accurate display of complex Web sites, support for new Web standards, and better overall performance + Clear Private Data very quickly by doing Ctrl+Shift+Del + Live Bookmarks update themselves automatically with the latest content from the Web + Multi Language Support - Can't do Windows Updates
Firefox Pic: [img]http://br.mozdev.org/firefox/firefox-window.png[/img]
[b]-> Internet Explorer[/b] [img]http://projects.edtech.sandi.net/lewis/thumbs/images/t_dn.gif[/img] + The only browser able to do windows updates + Comes with XP and you don't have to download or install it unless it gets corrupted - VERY VERY VERY EASY TO HACK - Looks like crap - Doesn't have that many features - So many bugs - Hardly ever updated - Whenever a feature is added, it has 100 more bugs they need to solve - When trying to delete cookies or other crap on your computer using IE, not all of it will have been deleted. Then you have to get programs such as CCleaner or hand delete the temporary files and cookies.
IE Pic: [img]http://mezzoblue.com/i/articles/4.08.04.ie-lg.gif[/img]
Click here to [url=http://www.getfirefox.com]Get the latest version of Firefox[/url].
C'mon, guess which browser I use. :) I use IE only for Windows Updates. You decide which one you want. Let me just say one last thing, so many viruses that come out almost daily infect IE first because so many people use it, cause they don't know any better. However, the same virus/adware would most likely be blocked by the good ol' fox!
And if you STILL think IE is better. Than look at this nice little [url=http://www.firefoxflicks.com/flick/?id=20674]Firefox Flick[/url].
So help spread firefox and say FUCK YOU to Microsoft and all the people who work for that demon, Bill Gates.
~Ron :)
Edit: Added pictures, more positives for firefox, more negatives for IE, and a spelling fix. The pictures are from the internet, I didn't screen them on my computer and upload them. I just found them using Google Images.

item.title: Mozilla Firefox vs Internet Explorer
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Unid H4x0r:

This is a overrated topic. No point in fighting over which browser is better. Just choose which you like better, who cares about what others think? If it works for you, then just use it.

IE is not best (or good) in anything, except excluding. (Active eXclude all.)

And like yakman said this is much easier to get infected by IE and Windows.

Read full topic

so it does effect other people,

you ever get spam email? blame it on botnets, windows and internet explorer (and other microsoft products)

item.title: Mozilla Firefox vs Internet Explorer
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“VB7 Rocks, post:145, topic:2165”][quote author=xxlegitxx link=topic=2279.msg1995856#msg1995856 date=1200297472]

First thing I do on every new computer:

Install Firefox and then install downloadthemall! its a great download manager for FF you get really incredible speeds.

First thing I do to every school computer:

Uninstall Firefox. Install Opera.
[/quote]

I’d use opera, but the scroll bars are ugly and when scrolling using the mouse wheel it’s not instant, but it kind of “slides” the page, I don’t like that.[/quote]
You can change Opera’s skin to make it look like you want.

Read full topic
